Carrie Stetko.Action: Responds to an unexpected interruption with slight annoyance but cooperates without complaint.
Maintains focus on her task despite an interruption; calmly acknowledges urgency and complies with the request to meet a professor.
Appears slightly annoyed by the interruption, which could indicate minor impatience or distraction.
Carrie is pictured smiling, arm-in-arm with Sam Murphy in a photograph, showing camaraderie and friendliness.
Carrie methodically marks off days on a calendar counting down to Winter-Over, showing awareness of time and psychological preparation for isolation.
Carrie darts a photograph of the South Pole at a dart board, possibly indicating frustration or venting emotions.
Carrie confidently navigates the harsh Antarctic environment, identifying and entering specific scientific buildings despite difficult weather.
Carrie does not show any uncertainty or hesitation when moving through McMurdo Station or approaching her destination.
Approaches scientists with familiarity, uses sarcastic humor to engage with Fred.
Politely thanks the scientist after receiving information.
Engages Sapperstein with direct questions, shows interest in his situation.
Approaches scientists with familiarity, uses sarcasm to build rapport, shows awareness of personnel by name, asks direct questions to gather information.
Listens attentively to serious information about missing samples, reacts with appropriate curiosity and focus.

Laughs softly despite the tense glare; playfully quizzes Professor Sapperstein with her badge; puts an arm around his shoulder and steers him away from others; pacifies him when he questions his sanity; suggests he plant cannabis to relax; pats him on the back.
Uses her authority as a United States Marshal by showing her badge confidently to persuade Professor Sapperstein to reconsider reporting the theft.
Calmly steers the nervous and reluctant professor away from his boisterous colleagues to have a private conversation, showing emotional intelligence and situational awareness.
Uses humor and a pacifying tone to manage the professor’s anxiety, demonstrating interpersonal skill and adaptability in a tense situation.
Pauses to look at herself in the mirror but dismisses fixing her hair, possibly indicating detachment or weariness.
Does not react to pencils falling, stares unhappily at binder, shows no outward expression of frustration or irritation.
Replies with dry humor when Murphy mentions a pilot sighting ('What flavor?' and 'And we were doing so well.'), indicating a subtle friendly rapport.
Acknowledges Murphy's presence and questions him politely despite obvious tension and awkwardness in the interaction.
Carrie deplanes at Amundsen-Scott Station with gear bag in tow and confidently heads into the base, showing familiarity with the environment (knows her way).
Leaves the dart board but takes a picture, a small but intentional personal choice.
She acknowledges Keller with a simple greeting but does not engage warmly; keeps the interaction brief and slightly dismissive.
Carrie pokes head into medical clinic and calls out for Doc, showing some consideration for others' whereabouts.

Maintains a sarcastic but confident tone when discussing her instincts with Doc, implying experience and self-awareness.

Mentions making stupid mistakes, indicating some self-awareness but also possible self-doubt.
Notes the identity and nationality of the corpse matter-of-factly without emotional reaction.

Identifies the location of the body accurately and confirms visual details confidently despite poor visibility.
Remains composed and attentive while navigating hazardous ice terrain alongside others, showing situational awareness.

Seeks additional information by asking Delfy about nearby camps, indicating thoroughness in investigation.

Calmly interacts with colleagues during a stressful, gruesome task, maintaining composure.
Quickly gathers and confirms key information (e.g., manager of Post Stations) and moves on efficiently.

Acknowledges desire to leave but commits to being all the help the injured man has at the moment.

Carefully uses steaming hot water to try to open the frozen zipper, demonstrating resourcefulness and skill.

Leans on the wall, visibly affected and wearing on her more than revealed.

Takes a moment to process the emotional weight of the situation, revealing some vulnerability but also composure.
Does not immediately dismiss the situation or give into fear, indicating resilience and professionalism.

Shows professionalism by staying focused and ignoring distractions (locker-room porno and cheering) while on duty.

Shows engagement and interest by asking about the status and plans of the meteorite collectors, indicating responsibility and concern for others' safety.

Persistently attempts communication despite static and no immediate response, showing patience and professional courtesy.

Questions unusual lack of evacuation arrangement, recognizing procedural irregularity.

Focuses on task with Delfy without further personal interaction.

Despite a violent gust knocking her off her feet, Carrie quickly regains her stance and continues forward, demonstrating resilience and control in extreme conditions.
Calls out for Mooney upon entering the building and cautiously investigates sounds of distress.
Proceeds carefully and alone into a potentially dangerous and dark building showing concern for others.
Navigates a harsh, windy environment, uses a tether to prevent falling, and keeps moving forward despite the conditions.
Uses tools (wheel-lock, flashlight, baton) appropriately and methodically to gain access, investigate, and protect herself in a dark building.
Demonstrates caution and strategic thinking by listening carefully, moving deliberately, and choosing a direction based on her judgment.

Cuts off Delfy when he asks about 'Jack', telling him to let it go.
Despite being wounded and having slow-moving fingers, insists on getting back into a dangerous environment to continue the investigation.
Focuses on the task at hand, methodically searching the lounge and retrieving her baton even after injury.

Commands others to retreat immediately when the ice starts falling, prioritizing safety.
